title: Auto populated columns are not properly deserialized on Active Record object creation
body:
When creating a new record, auto populated values returned by the database are assigned using `write_from_user` (via `_write_attribute`) instead of `write_from_database`.

https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/7fac5d14d00fcc8dc60b49729abe78223ad3bf00/activerecord/lib/active_record/persistence.rb#L933

This causes the value to be incorrect for some types, such as PostgreSQL binary values (`bytea`). 

### Steps to reproduce
* Use the PostgreSQL database adapter
* Add a binary (`bytea`) column with a default value generated by a function (such as `gen_random_bytes`)
* Create a new record

```ruby
# frozen_string_literal: true

require "bundler/inline"

gemfile(true) do
  source "https://rubygems.org"
  gem "rails"
  gem "pg"
end

require "active_record"
require "minitest/autorun"
require "logger"

ActiveRecord::Base.establish_connection(adapter: "postgresql", database: "rails_test")
ActiveRecord::Base.logger = Logger.new(STDOUT)

ActiveRecord::Schema.define do
  create_table :some_records, force: true do |t|
    t.binary :some_bytes, default: -> { "convert_to('A', 'UTF8')" }
  end
end

class SomeRecord < ActiveRecord::Base
end

class BugTest < ActiveSupport::TestCase
  def test_auto_populated
    assert_equal "A", SomeRecord.create.some_bytes
  end
end
```

### Expected behavior
The attribute's value should be equal to the value in the database: `'A'` (`41`).

### Actual behavior
The attribute's value is equal to the ["hex" format](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/datatype-binary.html#DATATYPE-BINARY-BYTEA-HEX-FORMAT) encoding of the value in the database: `'\x41'` (`5c 78 34 31`).

### System configuration
**Rails version**: 7.2.1.2, 8.0.0.rc1
**Ruby version**: 3.3.5
